emergencyWithdraw(address).details: Emergency withdraw token's balance on the contract

getExpectedMultiplier(uint256,uint256,ui.details: Returns corresponding yield boost multiplier simulating poolTotalAllocation returns multiplier * 1e4

getMultiplier(address,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Returns corresponding yield boost multiplier returns multiplier * 1e4

getPoolTotalAllocation(address).details: Returns total xARX allocated to this contract by "poolAddress"

getUserPosition(address,address,uint256).details: Returns the tokenId for a given user on a given poolAddress by index

getUserPositionAllocation(address,addres.details: Returns allocated xARX to "tokenId" spNFT from "poolAddress" NFTPool by "userAddress"

getUserPositionsLength(address,address).details: Returns the amount of boosted tokenId for a given user on a given poolAddress

getUserTotalAllocation(address).details: Returns total xARX allocated to this contract by "userAddress"

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setTotalAllocationFloor(uint256).details: Updates totalAllocationFloor value Can only be called by owner totalAllocationFloor cannot be set to 0

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateForcedDeallocationStatus(bool).details: Updates forcedDeallocation status Can only be called by owner Safety mechanism, should only be activated in case there is something wrong with this contract to avoid having stuck allocated xARX Contract should be discarded once activated

allocate(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Allocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX to this usage contract "data" should contain tokenId and poolAddress Can only be called by xARX contract, which is trusted to verify amounts

deallocate(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Deallocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX from this usage contract "data" should contain tokenId and poolAddress Can only be called by xArxToken contract, which is trusted to verify amounts

deallocateAllFromPool(address,uint256).notice: Deallocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX from this usage contract Can only be used by a pool contract, as msg.sender is used as poolAddress The pool should remove the allocated xARX (boost points) from its own spNFT when calling this function

forceDeallocate().notice: Deallocates msg.sender's "amount" of xARX from xArxToken, without adjusting this contract allocations balances Safety mechanism (cf. updateForcedDeallocationStatus)

documentation.text: @dev Returns the tokenId for a given user on a given poolAddress by index

@dev Updates forcedDeallocation status
 Can only be called by owner
 Safety mechanism, should only be activated in case there is something wrong with this contract to avoid having
 stuck allocated xARX
 Contract should be discarded once activated
@dev Emergency withdraw token's balance on the contract

Allocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX to this usage contract
 "data" should contain tokenId and poolAddress
 Can only be called by xARX contract, which is trusted to verify amounts

Deallocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX from this usage contract
 "data" should contain tokenId and poolAddress
 Can only be called by xArxToken contract, which is trusted to verify amounts

Deallocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX from this usage contract
 Can only be used by a pool contract, as msg.sender is used as poolAddress
 The pool should remove the allocated xARX (boost points) from its own spNFT when calling this function

Deallocates msg.sender's "amount" of xARX from xArxToken, without adjusting this contract allocations balances
 Safety mechanism (cf. updateForcedDeallocationStatus)

@dev Returns multiplier that should be applied to a spNFT based on its boost points (allocated xARX)
 The calculation is simply based on the ratio between userBoostPoints/totalPoolBoostPoints and userLP/totalLP
 To get the max bonus on a position where a user owns 1% of the pool's LP supply, he will have to allocate at least
 1% of the pool's allocated xARX
 The amount is capped at maxBoostMultiplier

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(address => struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage ref))

documentation.text: @dev Allocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX to "tokenId" spNFT of "poolAddress" pool

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(address => struct EnumerableSet.UintSet storage ref))

documentation.text: @dev Deallocates "userAddress" user's "amount" of xARX allocated to "tokenId" spNFT of "poolAddress" pool
